movies.title: Saul of Tarsus
movies.plot: Saul of Tarsus, a student of Jewish law, zealously persecutes early Christians. But after experiencing a blinding vision of Jesus while traveling to Damascus, where he intended to carry out more persecutions, Saul converts to Christianity. Changing his name to Paul, he becomes a tireless evangelist, preaching in the name of Jesus to Jews and Gentiles alike from the Near East to Rome. Saul is a student of Jewish law who is implacably opposed to the "heresy" of the Christian .He stands by as the Jewish religious court, the Sanherdrin, sentences Stephen to death by stoning for his Christian beliefs. The eager Saul even holds the coat of one of those who stones Stephen. Like the others, he doesn't see as the heavens open to Stephen, who says, "Behold, I see the heavens open, and the Son of Man standing on the right hand of God." Even the moderating influence of his teacher, Rabbi Gamaliel, has no influence on the hot-headed Saul. Saul unleashes a reign of terror against the Christians of ...

biography.bio: Brian Nissen is a writer and actor, known for The Swan Princess (1994), The Swan Princess: Escape from Castle Mountain (1997) and The King and I (1999).
biography.name: Brian Nissen

biography.bio: John Runnels is an actor, known for Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987) and The Animated Book of Mormon (1987).
biography.name: John Runnels

biography.bio: Gregory Snegoff was born on June 22, 1955 in Santa Monica, California, USA. He is an actor and writer, known for Misery (1990), Wicked City (1987) and Glengarry Glen Ross (1992). He is married to Fiorella Capuano. He was previously married to Lisa Michelson.
biography.name: Gregory Snegoff

biography.bio: Tony Larimer was born on April 18, 1929 in Evanston, Illinois, USA as Emmet Larimer. He was an actor, known for The Crow 3 - Salvation (2000), I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus (2002) and It Is Fine! Everything Is Fine. (2007). He was married to Marie C. Larimer and Mary Elizabeth. He died on March 10, 2009 in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA.
biography.name: Tony Larimer

biography.bio: Jonathan Hogan is an actor, known for Animated Hero Classics (1991) and Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987).
biography.name: Jonathan Hogan

biography.bio: Ivan Crosland was born on August 29, 1936. He was an actor, known for Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987), The ButterCream Gang (1992) and Brigham City (2001). He died on March 26, 2015 in Provo, Utah, USA.
biography.name: Ivan Crosland

biography.bio: Jack Whitaker was born on May 18, 1924. He is an actor and producer, known for 1971 NFL Pro Bowl (1971), AFL-NFL World Championship Game (1967) and Hot to Trot (1988). He was previously married to Nancy Chaffee.
biography.name: Jack Whitaker

biography.bio: Kim Blackett is an actor, known for The Animated Book of Mormon (1987) and Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987).
biography.name: Kim Blackett

biography.bio: David Jensen was born on December 30, 1947 in Logan, Utah, USA. He was an actor, known for Species (1995), Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers (1988) and The Substitute 3: Winner Takes All (1999). He was married to Jan L. Anderson and Carole L. Taylor. He died on November 29, 1998 in Salt Lake City, Utah.
biography.name: David Jensen

biography.bio: Erik Maylie is an actor, known for The Animated Book of Mormon (1987) and Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987).
biography.name: Erik Maylie

biography.bio: Bernie Van De Yacht hails from Green Bay, Wisconsin, the youngest of 12 children. He earned a BA in Psychology and Theatre from The University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire and an MFA from California Institute of the Arts (CalArts). After graduation, Bernie began working at an animation studio while he pursued his acting career. During that time, he was spotted by one of the artists and asked to pose for the character of Prince Derek in The Swan Princess. This opportunity allowed him to promote the movie all over the country, travel to the Cannes Film Festival, appear on a float in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade, and even have a doll made in his likeness. During this time, Bernie did theatre in and around the Los Angeles area. He eventually became an animation casting director and has been casting films for over eighteen years including The King and I, Trumpet of the Swan, Alpha and Omega, all the Swan Princess sequels, Happily N'ever After II and the upcoming Ribbit and Norm of the North. He has cast for Crest Animation, Morgan Creek, Warner Bros., Columbia/Tri-Star, Sony and Lionsgate. Recently he has branched into live action features and in the past two years has cast Blackjacks, Five Souls, The Speak and No Tell Motel. He is a proud member of the Casting Society of America (CSA) and was recently nominated for an Artios award for casting the animated feature film, Alpha and Omega. He is also a screenwriter and director. In 2004 he directed a short film called, There's Something About Meryl, which was the Official Selection at many film festivals around the country. Recently, he directed his first full-length feature film, Salvation, from his original screenplay. It has won multiple awards on the film festival circuit. In addition, he is prepping his next feature, Midwest Farmers' Daughters, once again based on his original screenplay. He and his wife have been married for twenty years and are the proud parents of two young sons.
biography.name: Bernie Van De Yacht

biography.bio: Michael Bennett is an actor, known for The Joseph Smith Story (1988) and Animated Stories from the New Testament (1987).
biography.name: Michael Bennett
